intro: Amsinckia melanocarpa, commonly known as the California fiddleneck, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in dry, sunny habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils. It has hairy, branched stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Amsinckia melanocarpa is adapted to arid conditions and is often found in regions with Mediterranean climates.
